ASE","body":"## What's Changed
* Fixes to exit tests. by @grynspan in https://github.com/swiftlang/swift-testing/pull/615
* Allow move-only types as suites. by @grynspan in https://github.com/swiftlang/swift-testing/pull/619
* Remove stray use of old `SWT_BUILDING_WITH_CMAKE` condition. by @grynspan in https://github.com/swiftlang/swift-testing/pull/621
* Warn when passing a non-optional value to `try #require(T?)`. by @grynspan in https://github.com/swiftlang/swift-testing/pull/620
* Reduce overhead of `.expectationChecked` event handling in `#expect()`. by @grynspan in https://github.com/swiftlang/swift-testing/pull/610
* Implement an overload of `confirmation()` that takes an unbounded range. by @grynspan in https://github.com/swiftlang/swift-testing/pull/598
* Fix a merge conflict on main-next. by @grynspan in https://github.com/swiftlang/swift-testing/pull/627
* Testing: use `clock_gettime` on Android by @compnerd in https://github.com/swiftlang/swift-testi
ng/pull/629
* Disallow `@Test` on member functions of `XCTestCase` subclasses. by @grynspan in https://github.com/swiftlang/swift-testing/pull/626
* Improve test coverage of CustomTestStringConvertible.swift. by @grynspan in https://github.com/swiftlang/swift-testing/pull/628
* Testing: add some force unwraps for Android by @compnerd in https://github.com/swiftlang/swift-testing/pull/631
* Fix incorrectly-specified platform list in CMake file. by @grynspan in https://github.com/swiftlang/swift-testing/pull/633
* Fix build errors in `ExitCondition` operators on platforms without exit tests. by @grynspan in https://github.com/swiftlang/swift-testing/pull/635
* Merge main-next into main. by @grynspan in https://github.com/swiftlang/swift-testing/pull/636
* Special-case comparisons of ranges in `__checkBinaryOperation()`. by @grynspan in https://github.com/swiftlang/swift-testing/pull/640
* Don't define `swt_getWASIVersion()` on non-WASI. by @grynspan in https://git
hub.com/swiftlang/swift-testing/pull/632
* Set the library version reported via CMake to 6.1-dev. by @grynspan in https://github.com/swiftlang/swift-testing/pull/637
* [6.0] Fix incorrectly-specified platform list in CMake file. by @grynspan in https://github.com/swiftlang/swift-testing/pull/634
* Add `isolation` argument to functions taking non-sendable async closures. by @grynspan in https://github.com/swiftlang/swift-testing/pull/624
* Generalize optional chaining detection used by `#require()`. by @grynspan in https://github.com/swiftlang/swift-testing/pull/625
* Plumb through the testing library version into a function instead of a C++ macro. by @grynspan in https://github.com/swiftlang/swift-testing/pull/648
* [CMake] Fix build with SwiftTesting_BuildMacrosAsExecutables option set by @ADKaster in https://github.com/swiftlang/swift-testing/pull/645
* Special-case `FileHandle(forWritingAtPath: "CONOUT$")` on Windows. by @grynspan in https://github.com/swiftla
ng/swift-testing/pull/654
* Add basic platform support for Android. by @grynspan in https://github.com/swiftlang/swift-testing/pull/653
* [android] fix 32 bit android build by @hyp in https://github.com/swiftlang/swift-testing/pull/656
* Optimizations to `Backtrace.current()`. by @grynspan in https://github.com/swiftlang/swift-testing/pull/647
* Do not include sysctl.h on Linux. by @grynspan in https://github.com/swiftlang/swift-testing/pull/660
* Add support for capturing backtraces from typed throws. by @grynspan in https://github.com/swiftlang/swift-testing/pull/642
* Optimize `failureBreakpoint()`. by @grynspan in https://github.com/swiftlang/swift-testing/pull/655
* Add an EditorConfig file by @stmontgomery in https://github.com/swiftlang/swift-testing/pull/600
* Remove `#expect(throws: Never.self)` and `#require(throws: Never.self)` as distinct overloads. by @grynspan in https://github.com/swiftlang/swift-testing/pull/661
* Replace rethrows with typed t
hrows in Graph by @stmontgomery in https://github.com/swiftlang/swift-testing/pull/662
* Work around compiler regression causing CI failure. by @grynspan in https://github.com/swiftlang/swift-testing/pull/664
* Work around swiftinterface generation bug on Windows. by @grynspan in https://github.com/swiftlang/swift-testing/pull/663
* Work around the swiftinterface generation issue for Android too by @hyp in https://github.com/swiftlang/swift-testing/pull/665
* Don't use `Synchronization.Atomic` for `deliverExpectationCheckedEvents`. by @grynspan in https://github.com/swiftlang/swift-testing/pull/666
* Exit tests shouldn't emit crash logs. by @grynspan in https://github.com/swiftlang/swift-testing/pull/670
* CMake: Install `_TestingInternals` in static library builds by @kateinoigakukun in https://github.com/swiftlang/swift-testing/pull/651
* Fix a typo in a call of install path getter function name by @kateinoigakukun in https://github.com/swiftlang/swift-testing/pu
ll/672
* Ask Foundation to capture `NSError`/`CFError` backtraces for us. by @grynspan in https://github.com/swiftlang/swift-testing/pull/673
* Expose the target triple as a separate string from the testing library version. by @grynspan in https://github.com/swiftlang/swift-testing/pull/652
* Revert "Replace rethrows with typed throws in Graph" by @artemcm in https://github.com/swiftlang/swift-testing/pull/679
* Silence a concurrency warning on Linux/Windows building an actor-isolated test. by @grynspan in https://github.com/swiftlang/swift-testing/pull/680
* [android] fix the build by @hyp in https://github.com/swiftlang/swift-testing/pull/681
* Add the current configuration to `Event.Context`. by @grynspan in https://github.com/swiftlang/swift-testing/pull/677
* Optionally symbolicate backtraces. by @grynspan in https://github.com/swiftlang/swift-testing/pull/676
* Add platform-specific branches for FreeBSD. by @grynspan in https://github.com/swiftlang/swift
-testing/pull/685
* Require explicit backtrace and source location when creating and recording issues by @stmontgomery in https://github.com/swiftlang/swift-testing/pull/688
* Remove the `Confirmation.ExpectedCount` marker protocol. by @grynspan in https://github.com/swiftlang/swift-testing/pull/689
* Switch to official 600.0.0 tag for swift-syntax by @stmontgomery in https://github.com/swiftlang/swift-testing/pull/690
* Move `spawnAndWait(forExecutableAtPath:)` to a separate file. by @grynspan in https://github.com/swiftlang/swift-testing/pull/695
* Un-revert "Replace rethrows with typed throws in Graph" by @stmontgomery in https://github.com/swiftlang/swift-testing/pull/692
* Add a `Pipe` type. by @grynspan in https://github.com/swiftlang/swift-testing/pull/694
* Disable pipes code on WASI. by @grynspan in https://github.com/swiftlang/swift-testing/pull/699
* CMake: Use `CMAKE_SYSTEM_NAME STREQUAL "WASI"` instead of `WASI` by @kateinoigakukun in https://gi
thub.com/swiftlang/swift-testing/pull/700
* Support: unwrap storage for parameter to `pipe` by @compnerd in https://github.com/swiftlang/swift-testing/pull/703
* Hoist JSON Lines logic from EntryPoint.swift. by @grynspan in https://github.com/swiftlang/swift-testing/pull/701
* Add manpage links for FreeBSD headers mentioned in documentation. by @grynspan in https://github.com/swiftlang/swift-testing/pull/704
* Preserve `verbosity` argument in `HumanReadableOutputRecorder.record()`. by @grynspan in https://github.com/swiftlang/swift-testing/pull/707
* Remove TemporaryGettingStarted.md. by @grynspan in https://github.com/swiftlang/swift-testing/pull/706
* Make the `ExitTest` type move-only. by @grynspan in https://github.com/swiftlang/swift-testing/pull/712
* Add a document about porting to new platforms. by @grynspan in https://github.com/swiftlang/swift-testing/pull/711
* [CMake] Explicitly link Testing to Foundation by @rintaro in https://github.com/swiftlang/s
wift-testing/pull/693
* Record issues generated within exit tests. by @grynspan in https://github.com/swiftlang/swift-testing/pull/697
* Avoid accidental use of `#_sourceLocation` in the library target. by @grynspan in https://github.com/swiftlang/swift-testing/pull/722
* Avoid truncating the path to the test executable on Windows. by @grynspan in https://github.com/swiftlang/swift-testing/pull/724
* Remove extraneous @escaping and @Sendable attributes from CustomExecutionTrait.execute(...) SPI by @stmontgomery in https://github.com/swiftlang/swift-testing/pull/726
* Walk PE files' sections instead of using `swift_enumerateAllMetadataSections()`. by @grynspan in https://github.com/swiftlang/swift-testing/pull/728
* Fix the 32-bit Windows build by @hjyamauchi in https://github.com/swiftlang/swift-testing/pull/731
* Don't use `swift_enumerateAllMetadataSections()` on WASI. by @grynspan in https://github.com/swiftlang/swift-testing/pull/730
* Only call `getsectiond
ata()` once per image. by @grynspan in https://github.com/swiftlang/swift-testing/pull/734
* Distinguish when an error is part of a recorded issue in an exit test. by @grynspan in https://github.com/swiftlang/swift-testing/pull/718
* Reset default signal handlers on child processes before spawning them. by @grynspan in https://github.com/swiftlang/swift-testing/pull/732
* Set `RLIMIT_CORE=1` instead of `=0` on Linux. by @grynspan in https://github.com/swiftlang/swift-testing/pull/737
* Do not emit a `time=` attribute in JUnit output for skipped tests. by @grynspan in https://github.com/swiftlang/swift-testing/pull/741
* Inherit isolation in `#expect(exitsWith:)`. by @grynspan in https://github.com/swiftlang/swift-testing/pull/736
* Fix macro expansion failure for a non-copyable suite type with a `test` method. by @grynspan in https://github.com/swiftlang/swift-testing/pull/739
* Disable reformatting of macro expansions. by @grynspan in https://github.com/swiftlang/
swift-testing/pull/743
* Disable formatting for more macros. by @grynspan in https://github.com/swiftlang/swift-testing/pull/744
* Simplify the configuration option for synchronous test isolation. by @grynspan in https://github.com/swiftlang/swift-testing/pull/747
* Simplify the thunk names we generate for test functions. by @grynspan in https://github.com/swiftlang/swift-testing/pull/750
* Fix a test that fails to compile on 32-bit targets. by @grynspan in https://github.com/swiftlang/swift-testing/pull/753
* Work around a compiler crash trying to demangle an expression macro inside an attached macro expansion. by @grynspan in https://github.com/swiftlang/swift-testing/pull/754
* Stub out symbolication on platforms without dynamic linking/loading. by @grynspan in https://github.com/swiftlang/swift-testing/pull/758
* Remove unintentional label from 'isolated' parameter on a thunk emitted by @Test by @stmontgomery in https://github.com/swiftlang/swift-testing/pull/7
59
* Combine the test discovery implementations for WASI and static Mach-O. by @grynspan in https://github.com/swiftlang/swift-testing/pull/761
* Update Porting.md to describe how to handle platforms that use static linkage. by @grynspan in https://github.com/swiftlang/swift-testing/pull/763
* Fix missing newlines in error JSON propagated from an exit test. by @grynspan in https://github.com/swiftlang/swift-testing/pull/767
* Add `.index-build` to `.gitignore` by @MaxDesiatov in https://github.com/swiftlang/swift-testing/pull/768
* Split `SWT_NO_EXIT_TESTS` into `SWT_NO_EXIT_TESTS` and `SWT_NO_PROCESS_SPAWNING`. by @grynspan in https://github.com/swiftlang/swift-testing/pull/769
* Add a return type for exit tests. by @grynspan in https://github.com/swiftlang/swift-testing/pull/762
* Update documentation to explain misconfigurations of `SWT_` conditions. by @grynspan in https://github.com/swiftlang/swift-testing/pull/772
* Handle signals on Windows in exit tests.
 by @grynspan in https://github.com/swiftlang/swift-testing/pull/766
* Avoid using `NTSTATUS` near `exit()`. by @grynspan in https://github.com/swiftlang/swift-testing/pull/776
* Ensure trailing trivia is trimmed from @Suite trait expressions by @stmontgomery in https://github.com/swiftlang/swift-testing/pull/778
* Make the result of an exit test optional with `#expect`. by @grynspan in https://github.com/swiftlang/swift-testing/pull/779
* Add support for collecting `stdout` and `stderr` in an exit test. by @grynspan in https://github.com/swiftlang/swift-testing/pull/773
* Make `ExitTestArtifacts.observedValues` properly sendable. by @grynspan in https://github.com/swiftlang/swift-testing/pull/781
* Fix some compiler conditional uses (`SWT_NO_*`). by @grynspan in https://github.com/swiftlang/swift-testing/pull/782
* [SWT-0005] Range-based confirmations by @grynspan in https://github.com/swiftlang/swift-testing/pull/691
* Update documentation for new `confirmatio
n()` overload. by @grynspan in https://github.com/swiftlang/swift-testing/pull/784
* Work around a crash importing FoundationXML. by @grynspan in https://github.com/swiftlang/swift-testing/pull/786
* Ensure the identifier of a "seen" object is only removed if the object's children were recursively reflected by @stmontgomery in https://github.com/swiftlang/swift-testing/pull/787
* Attachments! by @grynspan in https://github.com/swiftlang/swift-testing/pull/770
* DNM: Revert "Attachments! (#770)" by @tshortli in https://github.com/swiftlang/swift-testing/pull/793
* Ensure the `Bool` overload of `__checkBinaryOperation()` is still preferred. by @grynspan in https://github.com/swiftlang/swift-testing/pull/797
* Attachments! [Take 2] by @grynspan in https://github.com/swiftlang/swift-testing/pull/796
* WASI: Access to `EEXIST` through a stub getter function by @kateinoigakukun in https://github.com/swiftlang/swift-testing/pull/800
* Test cleanup: Remove an obsole
te fixture suite and add .hidden to a few tests by @stmontgomery in https://github.com/swiftlang/swift-testing/pull/803
* Specify the module to find the ABI entry point function in (in our own tests). by @grynspan in https://github.com/swiftlang/swift-testing/pull/801
* Fix a crash when describing a confirmation failure with a range. by @grynspan in https://github.com/swiftlang/swift-testing/pull/806
* Add support for platform-specific unconditional availability. by @grynspan in https://github.com/swiftlang/swift-testing/pull/807
* Do not perform full expansion of `#expect()` when `try` or `await` is present. by @grynspan in https://github.com/swiftlang/swift-testing/pull/790
* Eagerly move attachable values to the heap. by @grynspan in https://github.com/swiftlang/swift-testing/pull/809
* Revert "Eagerly move attachable values to the heap. (#809)" by @grynspan in https://github.com/swiftlang/swift-testing/pull/810
* Provide an environment flag to disable error b
acktrace capturing. by @grynspan in https://github.com/swiftlang/swift-testing/pull/812
* Provide an opt-out conditional for lazy attachment encoding. by @grynspan in https://github.com/swiftlang/swift-testing/pull/811
* Refine the Foundation error backtracing guard by @briancroom in https://github.com/swiftlang/swift-testing/pull/813
* Update install to ensure the build directory is not added to the rpath by @bnbarham in https://github.com/swiftlang/swift-testing/pull/792
* Work around Windows build failure due to SwiftPM regression. by @grynspan in https://github.com/swiftlang/swift-testing/pull/816
* Fix how we check if a range expression covers one value. by @grynspan in https://github.com/swiftlang/swift-testing/pull/815
* Make `Test.Attachment` generic. by @grynspan in https://github.com/swiftlang/swift-testing/pull/814
* SourceLocation.init should enforce valid arguments by @stmontgomery in https://github.com/swiftlang/swift-testing/pull/817
* Hoist `Atta
chment` and `Attachable` out of `Test`. by @grynspan in https://github.com/swiftlang/swift-testing/pull/821
* Update DocC symbol references for `Attachment` _et al._ by @grynspan in https://github.com/swiftlang/swift-testing/pull/822
* Add support for attachments to the Foundation cross-import overlay. by @grynspan in https://github.com/swiftlang/swift-testing/pull/819
* Defer the recursive propagation of suite traits until after filtering by @stmontgomery in https://github.com/swiftlang/swift-testing/pull/820
* Ensure tests representing containing types of suites are synthesized if necessary by @stmontgomery in https://github.com/swiftlang/swift-testing/pull/407
* [6.1] Remove '-dev' from package version by @grynspan in https://github.com/swiftlang/swift-testing/pull/839
* [6.1] Fix multiline comments not rendering correctly at CLI. by @grynspan in https://github.com/swiftlang/swift-testing/pull/852
* [6.1] Adopt prerelease tags of swift-syntax-601. by @grynspan i
n https://github.com/swiftlang/swift-testing/pull/851
* [6.1] [SWT-0006] Return the thrown error from `#expect(throws:)` and `#require(throws:)`. by @grynspan in https://github.com/swiftlang/swift-testing/pull/857
* [6.1] Mark `#expect(_:throws:)` and `#require(_:throws:)` as to-be-deprecated. by @grynspan in https://github.com/swiftlang/swift-testing/pull/879
* [6.1] Remove the `introduced: 6.0` argument from the to-be-deprecated attributes on  `#expect(performing:throws:)` and `#require(performing:throws:)`. by @grynspan in https://github.com/swiftlang/swift-testing/pull/889
* [6.1] [SWT-0007] Introduce API allowing traits to customize test execution by @stmontgomery in https://github.com/swiftlang/swift-testing/pull/907
* [6.1] Declare Swift 6.1 availability for TestScoping-related APIs by @stmontgomery in https://github.com/swiftlang/swift-testing/pull/930
* [6.1] Suppress warning about `#require(nonOptional)` in some cases. by @grynspan in https://github.com/swif
tlang/swift-testing/pull/949
* [6.1] Cleaning recently changed docs by @iamleeg in https://github.com/swiftlang/swift-testing/pull/958
* [6.1] Add an overview of test serialization to the XCTest migration guide by @iamleeg in https://github.com/swiftlang/swift-testing/pull/965
* [6.1] Note in documentation when `#expect(throws:)` started returning a value. by @grynspan in https://github.com/swiftlang/swift-testing/pull/990
* [6.1] Diagnose when using a non-escapable type as suite. by @grynspan in https://github.com/swiftlang/swift-testing/pull/992
* [6.1] Suppress `.unsafeFlags()` in Package.swift when tagging for release. by @grynspan in https://github.com/swiftlang/swift-testing/pull/993

## New Contributors
* @ADKaster made their first contribution in https://github.com/swiftlang/swift-testing/pull/645
* @artemcm made their first contribution in https://github.com/swiftlang/swift-testing/pull/679
* @hjyamauchi made their first contribution in https://gi
thub.com/swiftlang/swift-testing/pull/731

chatHistory.request_message:
**Context**: This is a macOS time-tracking application called "well-whaddya-know" with a frozen specification in `SPEC.md`. The project uses Swift and follows an event-sourcing architecture with immutable SQLite tables.

**Git workflow**:
- Create a new feature branch for this work
- Commit incrementally as you see fit
- You do not need approval to continue if tests are passing
- Follow the git branching rules from `~/.augment/rules/00_base_rules.md`

**Pre-implementation steps**:
1. Review all `.md` rule files in `~/.augment/rules/`
2. Review `SPEC.md` in its entirety to understand the full context

**Implementation scope** (implement ONLY these items):

1. **SQLite schema** (from SPEC.md Section 6.4):
   - Implement the exact DDL as specified for all tables: `identity`, `kv_metadata`, `applications`, `window_titles`, `tags`, `agent_runs`, `system_state_events`, `raw_activity_events`, `user_edit_events`
   - Implement all indexes exactly as specified
   - Implement all immutability triggers exactly as specified (preventing UPDATE and DELETE on event tables)
   - Do not modify, rename, or reinterpret any table names, column names, constraints, or data types

2. **SQLite configuration** (from SPEC.md Section 6.1):
   - Implement connection initialization with required PRAGMAs: `foreign_keys = ON`, `journal_mode = WAL`, `synchronous = NORMAL`, `busy_timeout = 5000`, `temp_store = MEMORY`

3. **Schema versioning and migrations** (from SPEC.md Section 6.3):
   - Implement schema versioning using `PRAGMA user_version`
   - Implement forward-only migration system
   - Create migration tracking table

4. **Unit tests** (per SPEC.md Section 14.4 Testing Policy):
   - Test that immutability triggers correctly prevent UPDATE operations on `system_state_events`, `raw_activity_events`, and `user_edit_events`
   - Test that immutability triggers correctly prevent DELETE operations on these same tables
   - Test schema initialization from scratch
   - Test schema migration paths
   - Test PRAGMA configurations are applied correctly
   - Test foreign key constraints are enforced
   - All tests must pass before work is considered complete

**Out of scope** (do NOT implement):
- UI components (`WellWhaddyaKnowApp`)
- Background agent (`wwkd` / `WellWhaddyaKnowAgent`)
- XPC communication
- Accessibility APIs or window title capture
- CLI (`wwk` / `WellWhaddyaKnowCLI`)
- App Store or Homebrew packaging
- Timeline builder logic
- Reporting queries
- Sensor wrappers

**Constraints**:
- Follow the exact schema from SPEC.md Section 6.4 without deviation
- The specification is frozen; do not rename, refactor, or reinterpret
- Stop when storage layer and tests are complete
- If any ambiguity exists in the specification, ask before proceeding rather than making assumptions

**Module location** (per SPEC.md Section 11.1):
- Place storage code in `Sources/Shared/Storage/`
- Place tests in `Tests/Unit/`

**Success criteria**:
- All tables, indexes, and triggers created exactly as specified
- All unit tests pass
- Immutability guarantees are enforced and verified by tests
- Schema versioning system is functional
- No code beyond storage layer is implemented

tool_result_node.content:
Here's the result of running `cat -n` on SPEC.md:
     1	# well-whaddya-know (macOS) Implementation Specification
     2	
     3	> This specification is frozen. Implementations must follow it exactly.
     4	> Changes require an explicit revision.
     5	
     6	A macOS-only, local-only time tracker that counts **working time strictly as “screen is unlocked”**, and attributes that time continuously to the **foreground application + window title**.
     7	
     8	This document is an implementation spec (not code). It is written to be handed to an implementation model for mechanical build-out.
     9	
    10	---
    11	
    12	## Scope, invariants, and hard constraints
    13	
    14	### Core definition (non-negotiable)
    15	
    16	**Working time** is defined strictly as:
    17	
    18	* Any time the macOS user session is **UNLOCKED**.
    19	
    20	**Not working time** is defined strictly as:
    21	
    22	* Screen locked
    23	* System asleep
    24	* System shut down
    25	
    26	**No keyboard, mouse, idle, or “activity” heuristics** are used. If the user walks away without locking, time is counted intentionally.
    27	
    28	**Foreground attribution** occurs continuously during unlocked time.
    29	
    30	### Required capabilities
    31	
    32	* macOS only
    33	* Local-only storage (no cloud, no network)
    34	* Continuous tracking while screen is unlocked
    35	* Foreground application + window title attribution
    36	* Accurate handling of lock, sleep, wake, shutdown
    37	* Per-machine + per-username attribution
    38	* Menu bar app as primary entry point
    39	* GUI viewer/editor (timeline + edits)
    40	* Command-line interface (CLI) using the same data store, distributed via Homebrew and direct download (not included in the Mac App Store build)
    41	* User editing:
    42	
    43	  * delete time ranges
    44	  * add time ranges
    45	  * apply tags
    46	* CSV and JSON export
    47	* App Store viable
    48	* Open-source and free
    49	
    50	### Non-goals (explicitly excluded)
    51	
    52	* No keystroke logging
    53	* No screenshots
    54	* No behavior scoring
    55	* No cloud sync
    56	* No productivity judgment
    57	
    58	---
    59	
    60	## Recommended implementation path (one path, explicit trade-offs)
    61	
    62	### Recommended path
    63	
    64	Build a sandboxed macOS app suite with:
    65	
    66	* A **login item background agent** (`wwkd`) that is the **only writer** to SQLite.
    67	* A **menu bar UI app** (`WellWhaddyaKnow.app`) that is a reader and sends edit/export commands to the agent via XPC.
    68	* A **viewer/editor window** inside `WellWhaddyaKnow.app` (same binary, different UI scenes).
    69	* A **command-line interface (CLI)** (`wwk`) implemented as a separate executable sharing the same schema and reporting logic, **distributed via Homebrew and direct download**.
    70	
    71	  * **The Mac App Store build omits the CLI entirely.**
    72	  * The CLI is not installed to PATH by the App Store build.
    73	  * CLI edit operations communicate with the background agent via XPC when available.
    74	
    75	### Assumptions
    76	
    77	* Minimum supported OS: **macOS 13 (Ventura)** so we can use `SMAppService` for login item and background task registration. ([Apple Developer][1])
    78	* Users will grant **Accessibility permission** to capture window titles. If not granted, we still track by app but window titles are `NULL`.
    79	* SQLite is sufficient (no Core Data required).
    80	
    81	### Trade-offs
    82	
    83	* Single-writer design (agent owns writes) simplifies concurrency and auditability, but means UI and CLI must talk to agent for edits.
    84	* Window title capture requires Accessibility permission; without it, attribution is lower fidelity.
    85	* “Accurate shutdown” is best-effort: graceful shutdown is detectable; hard power loss is not.
    86	
    87	---
    88	
    89	## 1. System architecture overview
    90	
    91	### High-level components
    92	
    93	1. **wwkd (Background Agent)**
    94	
    95	   * Runs at login as a registered background task/login item.
    96	   * Observes:
    97	
    98	     * session lock/unlock state
    99	     * system sleep/wake
   100	     * system power-off/logout request
   101	     * frontmost application changes
   102	     * focused window title changes (via Accessibility)
   103	   * Emits **immutable event log** into SQLite:
   104	
   105	     * `system_state_events` (lock/unlock/sleep/wake/poweroff snapshots)
   106	     * `raw_activity_events` (foreground context snapshots)
   107	   * Applies edits by writing `user_edit_events` (append-only).
   108	
   109	2. **WellWhaddyaKnow.app (Menu bar + Viewer/Editor)**
   110	
   111	   * Primary entry point via menu bar status item.
   112	   * Viewer/editor window for timeline + edits + tags.
   113	   * No direct DB writes (except optional emergency recovery mode, disabled by default).
   114	
   115	3. **wwk (CLI — non–App Store distribution)**
   116	
   117	   * Distributed via Homebrew and direct download.
   118	   * Uses the same SQLite schema and reporting logic as the app.
   119	   * Read-only reporting directly via SQLite.
   120	   * Edits and tag mutations go through XPC to the agent when available.
   121	
   122	
   123	### Data flow
   124	
   125	Sensors → Agent state machine → append events → SQLite (WAL) → reporting queries / timeline builder → UI + CLI outputs.
   126	
   127	### Storage location
   128	
   129	* SQLite file is stored in **App Group container**:
   130	
   131	  * `~/Library/Group Containers/<group-id>/WellWhaddyaKnow/wwk.sqlite`
   132	* Ensures the agent + app + CLI share the same file under sandbox.
   133	
   134	---
   135	
   136	## 2. Process model
   137	
   138	### 2.1 Background Agent: `wwkd`
   139	
   140	**Lifetime**
   141	
   142	* Starts at user login.
   143	* Runs continuously in user session.
   144	* Continues running while screen is locked (to observe unlock), but reduces activity when not working.
   145	
   146	**Responsibilities**
   147	
   148	* Owns all DB writes.
   149	* Maintains in-memory state machine:
   150	
   151	  * current working state
   152	  * current foreground context (app + title)
   153	  * permission status (Accessibility)
   154	* Provides XPC API:
   155	
   156	  * current status (working state + current context)
   157	  * read-only summary endpoints (optional)
   158	  * edit operations (delete/add/tag)
   159	  * export operations (optional; UI may export directly read-only, but agent export ensures consistent snapshot)
   160	
   161	**Crash and restart behavior**
   162	
   163	* On start, records an `agent_start` state snapshot.
   164	* On normal termination, records `agent_stop`.
   165	* If prior run ended without `agent_stop`, records a `gap_detected` state snapshot and marks the gap as “unobserved” (see edge cases).
   166	
   167	### 2.2 Menu bar app: `WellWhaddyaKnow.app`
   168	
   169	**Lifetime**
   170	
   171	* User launches it; it can also auto-launch.
   172	* Shows status item and popover.
   173	* Can open the viewer/editor window.
   174	
   175	**Responsibilities**
   176	
   177	* Displays:
   178	
   179	  * current working/not working state
   180	  * current foreground app + title (if available)
   181	  * today’s total working time
   182	* Entry points:
   183	
   184	  * Open Viewer
   185	  * Export (date range)
   186	  * Preferences (permissions, datastore path, about)
   187	  * Quit (stops tracking)
   188	
   189	### 2.3 Viewer/Editor (inside `WellWhaddyaKnow.app`)
   190	
   191	**Responsibilities**
   192	
   193	* Timeline visualization
   194	* Range edits:
   195	
   196	  * delete range
   197	  * add range
   198	  * apply tags
   199	* Tag management
   200	* Export UI
   201	
   202	### 2.4 CLI: `wwk`
   203	
   204	**Lifetime**
   205	
   206	* On-demand.
   207	* Read-only queries can work even if agent is not running.
   208	* Mutating operations require agent.
   209	
   210	**Responsibilities**
   211	
   212	* Status, summaries, exports, edits.
   213	
   214	---
   215	
   216	## 3. macOS APIs used
   217	
   218	### 3.1 Screen lock detection
   219	
   220	Primary mechanism: **Quartz session dictionary** via:
   221	
   222	* `CGSessionCopyCurrentDictionary()` (CoreGraphics/Quartz) ([Apple Developer][2])
   223	
   224	Interpretation rules (best available in practice):
   225	
   226	* `CGSSessionScreenIsLocked == 1` implies locked.
   227	* `kCGSessionOnConsoleKey == 1` implies this session owns the console (not fast-user-switched out). ([Stack Overflow][3])
   228	
   229	Event triggers to prompt re-check (documented):
   230	
   231	* `NSWorkspace.sessionDidResignActiveNotification`
   232	* `NSWorkspace.sessionDidBecomeActiveNotification` ([Apple Developer][4])
   233	
   234	Design note:
   235	
   236	* Do not depend on undocumented distributed notifications like `com.apple.screenIsLocked` for App Store builds. They may be used only in a non-App Store “developer build” behind a compile-time flag. (If included at all, keep out of release targets.)
   237	
   238	### 3.2 Sleep/wake detection
   239	
   240	Use NSWorkspace notifications:
   241	
   242	* `NSWorkspace.willSleepNotification` ([Apple Developer][5])
   243	* `NSWorkspace.didWakeNotification` ([Apple Developer][6])
   244	
   245	For shutdown/logout request:
   246	
   247	* `NSWorkspace.willPowerOffNotification` ([Apple Developer][7])
   248	
   249	Reliability hardening:
   250	
   251	* Add an IOKit power notification source as a secondary channel if NSWorkspace is missed (implementation detail). NSWorkspace is still the primary documented surface.
   252	
   253	### 3.3 Foreground app detection
   254	
   255	Use NSWorkspace:
   256	
   257	* `NSWorkspace.didActivateApplicationNotification` ([Apple Developer][8])
   258	* Query `NSWorkspace.shared.frontmostApplication` for current app bundle id, PID, localized name.
   259	
   260	### 3.4 Foreground window title detection
   261	
   262	Use Accessibility API:
   263	
   264	* `AXUIElementCreateApplication(pid)`
   265	* Read:
   266	
   267	  * `kAXFocusedWindowAttribute`
   268	  * `kAXTitleAttribute` (or on the window element)
   269	* Subscribe via AXObserver:
   270	
   271	  * `kAXTitleChangedNotification` ([Apple Developer][9])
   272	  * `kAXFocusedWindowChangedNotification` (and optionally main window changed)
   273	
   274	Permission:
   275	
   276	* `AXIsProcessTrustedWithOptions` to prompt and detect accessibility authorization state.
   277	
   278	Fallback:
   279	
   280	* If AX notifications fail for an app, poll title every N seconds while working (see tracking loop).
   281	
   282	---
   283	
   284	## 4. Precise definition of working vs non-working states
   285	
   286	### 4.1 State variables
   287	
   288	The agent maintains these booleans continuously:
   289	
   290	1. `isSystemAwake`
   291	
   292	* True when system is not asleep.
   293	* Set false on `willSleep`.
   294	* Set true on `didWake`.
   295	
   296	2. `isSessionOnConsole`
   297	
   298	* Derived from `CGSessionCopyCurrentDictionary()`:
   299	
   300	  * `kCGSessionOnConsoleKey == 1` means on-console. ([Stack Overflow][3])
   301	  * If dictionary missing or key missing, treat as false.
   302	
   303	3. `isScreenLocked`
   304	
   305	* Derived from `CGSessionCopyCurrentDictionary()`:
   306	
   307	  * `CGSSessionScreenIsLocked == 1` means locked. ([Stack Overflow][3])
   308	  * If key missing, treat as unlocked only if session is on console; otherwise unknown defaults to not working.
   309	
   310	### 4.2 Derived working state (single authoritative rule)
   311	
   312	`isWorking = isSystemAwake && isSessionOnConsole && !isScreenLocked`
   313	
   314	This is the only rule used to count time.
   315	
   316	### 4.3 Handling “unknown”
   317	
   318	If `CGSessionCopyCurrentDictionary()` returns `NULL` or a dictionary without required fields, treat as:
   319	
   320	* `isSessionOnConsole = false`
   321	* `isScreenLocked = true` (conservative)
   322	* Therefore `isWorking = false`
   323	
   324	This avoids inventing working time when the agent cannot observe state.
   325	
   326	---
   327	
   328	## 5. Event lifecycle and edge cases
   329	
   330	### 5.1 Event types (conceptual)
   331	
   332	All persisted events are immutable append-only rows. There are three event streams:
   333	
   334	1. `system_state_events` (snapshots and transitions)
   335	2. `raw_activity_events` (foreground context snapshots)
   336	3. `user_edit_events` (user-driven overlays)
   337	
   338	### 5.2 Agent startup sequence
   339	
   340	On agent launch:
   341	
   342	1. Generate a `run_id` (UUID).
   343	2. Load identity (machine_id, username, uid) from DB or initialize.
   344	3. Initialize SQLite connection in WAL mode.
   345	4. Probe current session state via `CGSessionCopyCurrentDictionary()`.
   346	5. Emit `system_state_events` row of kind `agent_start` with full snapshot.
   347	6. If `isWorking`, immediately emit a `raw_activity_events` snapshot of current frontmost app + title (if permitted).
   348	
   349	### 5.3 Main loop behavior
   350	
   351	While running:
   352	
   353	* State updates are triggered by:
   354	
   355	  * NSWorkspace session active/resign notifications
   356	  * willSleep/didWake
   357	  * willPowerOff
   358	  * periodic probe timer (recommended: every 2 seconds while not working; every 1 second while working)
   359	* Foreground context updates are triggered by:
   360	
   361	  * didActivateApplicationNotification
   362	  * AX observer notifications on active app
   363	  * fallback poll timer (recommended: 1 second while working)
   364	
   365	### 5.4 Transition rules
   366	
   367	When state changes cause `isWorking` to flip:
   368	
   369	* If `isWorking` transitions `false -> true`:
   370	
   371	  * Emit `system_state_events` snapshot
   372	  * Emit `raw_activity_events` snapshot immediately (so the working interval begins attributed as soon as possible)
   373	* If `isWorking` transitions `true -> false`:
   374	
   375	  * Emit `system_state_events` snapshot
   376	  * Stop AX observation and polling until working resumes
   377	
   378	### 5.5 Edge cases and required behaviors
   379	
   380	#### A. Fast User Switching (session switched out)
   381	
   382	* `isSessionOnConsole` becomes false. Count no time.
   383	* Continue running but minimize activity.
   384	* When session returns on console:
   385	
   386	  * Re-probe CGSession dictionary
   387	  * Only resume working if unlocked.
   388	
   389	Apple explicitly notes that processes in a switched-out session continue running but do not receive input, and it may be beneficial to adjust behavior. ([Apple Developer][10])
   390	
   391	#### B. Display sleep vs system sleep
   392	
   393	* Display sleep (screens sleep) is NOT system sleep. Do not treat it as not working.
   394	* Only system sleep counts as not working (from willSleep to didWake).
   395	
   396	#### C. Sleep while unlocked
   397	
   398	* On `willSleep`, end working at that timestamp (via state event).
   399	* After `didWake`, do not assume unlocked; lock screen may appear. Re-probe.
   400	
   401	#### D. Shutdown / logout
   402	
   403	* On `willPowerOff`, emit a `system_state_events` snapshot that forces `isWorking = false` at that timestamp. ([Apple Developer][7])
   404	* After `willPowerOff`, flush DB immediately (fsync behavior is SQLite-dependent; use `PRAGMA synchronous=FULL` during final flush if needed. This is best-effort and not relied upon for correctness.).
   405	* If shutdown is hard (power loss), no event will be logged; see gap handling.
   406	
   407	#### E. Agent crash / kill / disabled login item
   408	
   409	* If the agent is not running, there is no tracking. This is an observability gap.
   410	* On next start:
   411	
   412	  * Detect last `agent_start` without a matching `agent_stop`.
   413	  * Emit a `system_state_events` row with kind `gap_detected` including:
   414	
   415	    * `gap_start_ts_us = last_seen_event_ts_us`
   416	    * `gap_end_ts_us = now_ts_us`
   417	  * Reporting must treat gap time as **not working / unobserved**, never as working.
   418	
   419	Rationale: do not invent work time when the observer is down.
   420	
   421	#### F. System clock changes (NTP jumps or manual changes)
   422	
   423	Required mitigation:
   424	
   425	* Store wall-clock timestamps as UTC microseconds.
   426	* Also store a monotonic time sample (see schema) at each system state snapshot.
   427	* If wall-clock delta deviates from monotonic delta by > 120 seconds, emit a `clock_change` system state event.
   428	* Reporting must prefer monotonic deltas for ordering checks, but durations are still computed in wall-clock for user-facing time ranges.
   429	
   430	#### G. Accessibility permission revoked mid-run
   431	
   432	* If AX permission becomes unavailable:
   433	
   434	  * Emit a `system_state_events` event of kind `accessibility_denied`.
   435	  * Continue tracking by app only (window title `NULL`).
   436	  * UI must show degraded attribution status.
   437	
   438	---
   439	
   440	## 6. Exact SQLite schema
   441	
   442	### 6.1 SQLite configuration
   443	
   444	On every connection open:
   445	
   446	* `PRAGMA foreign_keys = ON;`
   447	* `PRAGMA journal_mode = WAL;`
   448	* `PRAGMA synchronous = NORMAL;` (agent uses NORMAL during steady-state; temporarily elevate on shutdown flush)
   449	* `PRAGMA busy_timeout = 5000;`
   450	* `PRAGMA temp_store = MEMORY;`
   451	
   452	### 6.2 Timestamp conventions
   453	
   454	* All timestamps stored as **UTC microseconds since Unix epoch** in `INTEGER` columns named `*_ts_us`.
   455	* Intervals are always treated as half-open: `[start_ts_us, end_ts_us)`.
   456	
   457	### 6.3 Schema versioning
   458	
   459	* Use `PRAGMA user_version` as schema version integer.
   460	* All migrations are forward-only, with a migration table recording applied versions.
   461	
   462	### 6.4 DDL
   463	
   464	The following schema is normative.
   465	
   466	```sql
   467	-- =========================
   468	-- Core identity and metadata
   469	-- =========================
   470	
   471	CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS identity (
   472	  identity_id            INTEGER PRIMARY KEY CHECK (identity_id = 1),
   473	  machine_id             TEXT NOT NULL,         -- UUID generated on first run, stored locally
   474	  username               TEXT NOT NULL,         -- short username at DB creation time
   475	  uid                    INTEGER NOT NULL,      -- numeric user id at DB creation time
   476	  created_ts_us          INTEGER NOT NULL,
   477	  app_group_id           TEXT NOT NULL,         -- for diagnostics
   478	  notes                  TEXT
   479	);
   480	
   481	CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS kv_metadata (
   482	  key                    TEXT PRIMARY KEY,
   483	  value                  TEXT NOT NULL
   484	);
   485	
   486	-- =========================
   487	-- Dimension tables (optional but required by this spec)
   488	-- =========================
   489	
   490	CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS applications (
   491	  app_id                 INTEGER PRIMARY KEY,
   492	  bundle_id              TEXT NOT NULL UNIQUE,
   493	  display_name           TEXT NOT NULL,
   494	  first_seen_ts_us       INTEGER NOT NULL
   495	);
   496	
   497	CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS window_titles (
   498	  title_id               INTEGER PRIMARY KEY,
   499	  title                  TEXT NOT NULL UNIQUE,
   500	  first_seen_ts_us       INTEGER NOT NULL
   501	);
   502	
   503	CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS tags (
   504	  tag_id                 INTEGER PRIMARY KEY,
   505	  name                   TEXT NOT NULL UNIQUE,
   506	  created_ts_us          INTEGER NOT NULL,
   507	  retired_ts_us          INTEGER,               -- NULL = active
   508	  sort_order             INTEGER NOT NULL DEFAULT 0
   509	);
   510	
   511	-- =========================
   512	-- Run tracking (diagnostic, immutable)
   513	-- =========================
   514	
   515	CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS agent_runs (
   516	  run_id                 TEXT PRIMARY KEY,      -- UUID
   517	  started_ts_us          INTEGER NOT NULL,
   518	  started_monotonic_ns   INTEGER NOT NULL,
   519	  agent_version          TEXT NOT NULL,
   520	  os_version             TEXT NOT NULL,
   521	  hardware_model         TEXT,
   522	  boot_session_id        TEXT                  -- best-effort stable ID for this boot
   523	);
   524	
   525	-- =========================
   526	-- System state events (immutable, append-only)
   527	-- =========================
   528	
   529	CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS system_state_events (
   530	  sse_id                 INTEGER PRIMARY KEY,
   531	  run_id                 TEXT NOT NULL REFERENCES agent_runs(run_id),
   532	
   533	  event_ts_us            INTEGER NOT NULL,
   534	  event_monotonic_ns     INTEGER NOT NULL,
   535	
   536	  -- Observed state snapshot AFTER applying this event
   537	  is_system_awake        INTEGER NOT NULL CHECK (is_system_awake IN (0,1)),
   538	  is_session_on_console  INTEGER NOT NULL CHECK (is_session_on_console IN (0,1)),
   539	  is_screen_locked       INTEGER NOT NULL CHECK (is_screen_locked IN (0,1)),
   540	  is_working             INTEGER NOT NULL CHECK (is_working IN (0,1)),
   541	
   542	  -- Event classification
   543	  event_kind             TEXT NOT NULL CHECK (
   544	                           event_kind IN (
   545	                             'agent_start',
   546	                             'agent_stop',
   547	                             'state_change',
   548	                             'sleep',
   549	                             'wake',
   550	                             'poweroff',
   551	                             'gap_detected',
   552	                             'clock_change',
   553	                             'tz_change',
   554	                             'accessibility_denied',
   555	                             'accessibility_granted'
   556	                           )
   557	                         ),
   558	
   559	  -- Source channel for observability
   560	  source                 TEXT NOT NULL CHECK (
   561	                           source IN (
   562	                             'startup_probe',
   563	                             'workspace_notification',
   564	                             'timer_poll',
   565	                             'iokit_power',
   566	                             'shutdown_hook',
   567	                             'manual'
   568	                           )
   569	                         ),
   570	
   571	  -- Optional additional fields
   572	  tz_identifier          TEXT NOT NULL,          -- TimeZone.current.identifier at event time
   573	  tz_offset_seconds      INTEGER NOT NULL,       -- seconds east of UTC at event time
   574	
   575	  payload_json           TEXT                    -- JSON object, strictly optional; avoid PII
   576	);
   577	
   578	CREATE INDEX IF NOT EXISTS idx_sse_event_ts
   579	ON system_state_events(event_ts_us);
   580	
   581	CREATE INDEX IF NOT EXISTS idx_sse_run_id
   582	ON system_state_events(run_id);
   583	
   584	-- Enforce immutability for system_state_events
   585	CREATE TRIGGER IF NOT EXISTS trg_sse_no_update
   586	BEFORE UPDATE ON system_state_events
   587	BEGIN
   588	  SELECT RAISE(ABORT, 'system_state_events is immutable');
   589	END;
   590	
   591	CREATE TRIGGER IF NOT EXISTS trg_sse_no_delete
   592	BEFORE DELETE ON system_state_events
   593	BEGIN
   594	  SELECT RAISE(ABORT, 'system_state_events is immutable');
   595	END;
   596	
   597	-- =========================
   598	-- Raw activity events (immutable, append-only)
   599	-- Foreground context snapshots during working time
   600	-- =========================
   601	
   602	CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS raw_activity_events (
   603	  rae_id                 INTEGER PRIMARY KEY,
   604	  run_id                 TEXT NOT NULL REFERENCES agent_runs(run_id),
   605	
   606	  event_ts_us            INTEGER NOT NULL,
   607	  event_monotonic_ns     INTEGER NOT NULL,
   608	
   609	  -- Foreground app
   610	  app_id                 INTEGER NOT NULL REFERENCES applications(app_id),
   611	  pid                    INTEGER NOT NULL,
   612	
   613	  -- Foreground window title (nullable if not permitted or not available)
   614	  title_id               INTEGER REFERENCES window_titles(title_id),
   615	
   616	  -- Whether this snapshot had title access
   617	  title_status           TEXT NOT NULL CHECK (
   618	                           title_status IN (
   619	                             'ok',
   620	                             'no_permission',
   621	                             'not_supported',
   622	                             'no_window',
   623	                             'error'
   624	                           )
   625	                         ),
   626	
   627	  -- Reason for emitting this snapshot
   628	  reason                 TEXT NOT NULL CHECK (
   629	                           reason IN (
   630	                             'working_began',
   631	                             'app_activated',
   632	                             'ax_title_changed',
   633	                             'ax_focused_window_changed',
   634	                             'poll_fallback'
   635	                           )
   636	                         ),
   637	
   638	  -- Defensive flag, should be 1 for all rows
   639	  is_working             INTEGER NOT NULL CHECK (is_working IN (0,1)),
   640	
   641	  ax_error_code          INTEGER,                -- AXError as integer if title_status='error'
   642	  payload_json           TEXT                    -- optional diagnostics, no PII beyond title
   643	);
   644	
   645	CREATE INDEX IF NOT EXISTS idx_rae_event_ts
   646	ON raw_activity_events(event_ts_us);
   647	
   648	CREATE INDEX IF NOT EXISTS idx_rae_app_id_ts
   649	ON raw_activity_events(app_id, event_ts_us);
   650	
   651	CREATE INDEX IF NOT EXISTS idx_rae_run_id
   652	ON raw_activity_events(run_id);
   653	
   654	-- Enforce immutability for raw_activity_events
   655	CREATE TRIGGER IF NOT EXISTS trg_rae_no_update
   656	BEFORE UPDATE ON raw_activity_events
   657	BEGIN
   658	  SELECT RAISE(ABORT, 'raw_activity_events is immutable');
   659	END;
   660	
   661	CREATE TRIGGER IF NOT EXISTS trg_rae_no_delete
   662	BEFORE DELETE ON raw_activity_events
   663	BEGIN
   664	  SELECT RAISE(ABORT, 'raw_activity_events is immutable');
   665	END;
   666	
   667	-- =========================
   668	-- User edit events (immutable, append-only overlays)
   669	-- =========================
   670	
   671	CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS user_edit_events (
   672	  uee_id                 INTEGER PRIMARY KEY,
   673	  created_ts_us          INTEGER NOT NULL,
   674	  created_monotonic_ns   INTEGER NOT NULL,
   675	
   676	  author_username        TEXT NOT NULL,
   677	  author_uid             INTEGER NOT NULL,
   678	
   679	  client                 TEXT NOT NULL CHECK (client IN ('ui', 'cli')),
   680	  client_version         TEXT NOT NULL,
   681	
   682	  op                     TEXT NOT NULL CHECK (
   683	                           op IN (
   684	                             'delete_range',
   685	                             'add_range',
   686	                             'tag_range',
   687	                             'untag_range',
   688	                             'undo_edit'
   689	                           )
   690	                         ),
   691	
   692	  start_ts_us            INTEGER NOT NULL,
   693	  end_ts_us              INTEGER NOT NULL CHECK (end_ts_us > start_ts_us),
   694	
   695	  -- Tag ops
   696	  tag_id                 INTEGER REFERENCES tags(tag_id),
   697	
   698	  -- Manual add attribution (only for add_range)
   699	  manual_app_bundle_id   TEXT,
   700	  manual_app_name        TEXT,
   701	  manual_window_title    TEXT,
   702	
   703	  -- Optional note shown in UI
   704	  note                   TEXT,
   705	
   706	  -- Undo support
   707	  target_uee_id          INTEGER REFERENCES user_edit_events(uee_id),
   708	
   709	  payload_json           TEXT
   710	);
   711	
   712	CREATE INDEX IF NOT EXISTS idx_uee_created_ts
   713	ON user_edit_events(created_ts_us);
   714	
   715	CREATE INDEX IF NOT EXISTS idx_uee_range
   716	ON user_edit_events(start_ts_us, end_ts_us);
   717	
   718	CREATE INDEX IF NOT EXISTS idx_uee_op
   719	ON user_edit_events(op);
   720	
   721	-- Enforce immutability for user_edit_events
   722	CREATE TRIGGER IF NOT EXISTS trg_uee_no_update
   723	BEFORE UPDATE ON user_edit_events
   724	BEGIN
   725	  SELECT RAISE(ABORT, 'user_edit_events is immutable');
   726	END;
   727	
   728	CREATE TRIGGER IF NOT EXISTS trg_uee_no_delete
   729	BEFORE DELETE ON user_edit_events
   730	BEGIN
   731	  SELECT RAISE(ABORT, 'user_edit_events is immutable');
   732	END;
   733	```
   734	
   735	---
   736	
   737	## 7. How edits are layered without mutating raw data
   738	
   739	### 7.1 Core principle: event sourcing with overlays
   740	
   741	* `system_state_events` and `raw_activity_events` define the **raw observed timeline**.
   742	* `user_edit_events` define a **layered “patch set”** that transforms the raw timeline into an “effective timeline”.
   743	* Raw tables are immutable by triggers. All user modifications are expressed as additional events.
   744	
   745	### 7.2 Effective timeline construction order (deterministic)
   746	
   747	Given a requested report range `[R0, R1)`:
   748	
   749	1. **Compute base working intervals** from `system_state_events`.
   750	2. **Compute base attribution segments** from `raw_activity_events` intersected with working intervals.
   751	3. **Apply user edits** in this strict order:
   752	
   753	   1. Apply all `undo_edit` (filter out undone edits first, see below)
   754	   2. Apply all `delete_range` (subtract time)
   755	   3. Apply all `add_range` (insert time, with precedence over base segments)
   756	   4. Apply `tag_range` / `untag_range` as metadata overlays (no duration changes)
   757	
   758	### 7.3 Undo semantics
   759	
   760	* `undo_edit` targets a prior `uee_id`.
   761	* An edit is considered **inactive** if it is targeted by an `undo_edit` that is itself not undone.
   762	* If multiple undos exist, the most recent (by `created_ts_us`) wins.
   763	* No raw edit row is ever deleted or updated.
   764	
   765	### 7.4 Precedence rules for overlaps
   766	
   767	Overlaps can occur when:
   768	
   769	* user adds a range overlapping raw observed time
   770	* user deletes a range that overlaps a user-added range
   771	
   772	Precedence rules:
   773	
   774	1. **Delete beats everything**: if a time slice is deleted, it is removed even if it came from a manual add.
   775	2. **Manual add beats raw observation**: for overlapping time, the manual add replaces the raw segment attribution.
   776	3. Tags are additive overlays and can overlap anything unless explicitly untagged.
   777	
   778	### 7.5 Segment subtraction and splitting
   779	
   780	All timeline manipulation is done by:
   781	
   782	* subtracting intervals from segments (may split into up to 2 segments)
   783	* inserting segments and then resolving overlaps by splitting neighbors
   784	
   785	This must be implemented in a pure, deterministic function so:
   786	
   787	* UI and CLI outputs match exactly
   788	* regression testing is possible using fixture event streams
   789	
   790	---
   791	
   792	## 8. Reporting primitives derivable from the model
   793	
   794	### 8.1 Primitive outputs (the internal “reporting IR”)
   795	
   796	All reporting should be derived from a canonical list of **effective segments**:
   797	
   798	`EffectiveSegment` fields:
   799	
   800	* `start_ts_us`, `end_ts_us`, `duration_seconds`
   801	* `source` = `raw` | `manual`
   802	* `app_bundle_id`, `app_name`
   803	* `window_title` (nullable)
   804	* `tags`: `[String]`
   805	* `coverage` = `observed` | `unobserved_gap`
   806	* `supporting_ids`: list of event IDs used (optional for debugging/export)
   807	
   808	### 8.2 Required reports
   809	
   810	From effective segments, derive:
   811	
   812	* Total working time in range
   813	* Daily totals (local timezone)
   814	* Totals by application (bundle id)
   815	* Totals by window title (optional, only when title present)
   816	* Totals by tag
   817	* Unattributed time (no title, or no app due to errors)
   818	* Gap time (agent down / unobserved)
   819	
   820	### 8.3 “Today” definition
   821	
   822	“Today” in UI means local calendar day based on the user’s current timezone, but daily grouping must respect `tz_identifier` and DST transitions based on segment timestamps.
   823	
   824	Implementation requirement:
   825	
   826	* Convert each segment’s start/end to local time and split at local midnight boundaries.
   827	
   828	### 8.4 Export formats
   829	
   830	#### CSV export (effective segments)
   831	
   832	Header (exact columns):
   833	
   834	1. `machine_id`
   835	2. `username`
   836	3. `segment_start_local`
   837	4. `segment_end_local`
   838	5. `segment_start_utc`
   839	6. `segment_end_utc`
   840	7. `duration_seconds`
   841	8. `source`
   842	9. `app_bundle_id`
   843	10. `app_name`
   844	11. `window_title`
   845	12. `tags` (semicolon-separated)
   846	13. `coverage` (`observed` or `unobserved_gap`)
   847	
   848	Rules:
   849	
   850	* `window_title` is empty string if NULL.
   851	* Timestamps are ISO-8601 strings with timezone offsets for local, and `Z` for UTC.
   852	
   853	#### JSON export (effective segments)
   854	
   855	Top-level object:
   856	
   857	* `identity`: { machine_id, username, uid }
   858	* `exported_at_utc`
   859	* `range`: { start_utc, end_utc }
   860	* `segments`: array of segment objects matching the EffectiveSegment fields (timestamps as ISO-8601 strings)
   861	
   862	No raw events are exported by default unless user explicitly selects “debug export”.
   863

   866	## 9. UI scope and interaction flows
   867	
   868	### 9.1 Menu bar UI (primary)
   869	
   870	Popover content:
   871	
   872	* Status line:
   873	
   874	  * “Working” if `isWorking==1`
   875	  * “Not working” otherwise
   876	* Current attribution:
   877	
   878	  * App name
   879	  * Window title (if available; otherwise show “(title unavailable)”)
   880	* Today total working time
   881	* Buttons:
   882	
   883	  * Open Viewer
   884	  * Export…
   885	  * Preferences…
   886	  * Quit (stops tracking)
   887	
   888	UI requirements:
   889	
   890	* Always show whether Accessibility permission is granted.
   891	* If denied, show a single click path to open System Settings Privacy and Security Accessibility panel (deep-link if possible; otherwise open System Settings and instruct).
   892	
   893	### 9.2 Viewer/Editor window
   894	
   895	Three primary tabs (or sidebar items):
   896	
   897	1. **Timeline**
   898	2. **Tags**
   899	3. **Exports**
   900	
   901	#### Timeline view
   902	
   903	* Date picker (day-level) plus week navigation
   904	* Main list view of segments:
   905	
   906	  * start-end
   907	  * duration
   908	  * app + title
   909	  * tag chips
   910	
   911	Selection:
   912	
   913	* User can select a contiguous time range (drag on a timeline or shift-select rows) and apply actions:
   914	
   915	  * Delete range
   916	  * Add range (opens dialog pre-filled with selection)
   917	  * Tag range (choose existing tag)
   918	  * Untag range (choose tag)
   919	
   920	#### Add range dialog
   921	
   922	Fields:
   923	
   924	* Start (local datetime)
   925	* End (local datetime)
   926	* Attribution:
   927	
   928	  * App name (free text) and optional bundle id
   929	  * Window title (free text)
   930	* Tags (multi-select)
   931	* Note
   932	
   933	On save:
   934	
   935	* Emit `user_edit_events.op = add_range`
   936	* Also emit `tag_range` events for selected tags (or store tags in payload_json, but spec prefers separate tag events for audit clarity)
   937	
   938	#### Delete range dialog
   939	
   940	Fields:
   941	
   942	* Start/end (fixed)
   943	* Note (optional)
   944	  On save:
   945	* Emit `delete_range`
   946	
   947	#### Tag management view
   948	
   949	* List tags
   950	* Create tag
   951	* Rename tag (implemented as: create new tag + retire old tag OR allow updating `tags.name` with an audit entry in payload_json; choose one approach and stick to it)
   952	* Retire tag (sets `retired_ts_us`)
   953	
   954	### 9.3 Preferences
   955	
   956	* Data location (read-only display + “Reveal in Finder”)
   957	* Accessibility permission status
   958	* Background agent running status (XPC ping)
   959	* Export defaults (format, include titles yes/no default toggle)
   960	* “Delete all data” action:
   961	
   962	  * Requires explicit confirmation
   963	  * Implemented as: move SQLite file to trash and recreate identity

   967	## 10. CLI command surface (`wwk`)
   968	
   969	### 10.1 Command design rules
   970	
   971	* Every command must support:
   972	
   973	  * `--db <path>` optional override (default: app group path)
   974	  * `--json` machine-readable output when applicable
   975	* Commands that mutate must:
   976	
   977	  * Require agent reachable via XPC
   978	  * Fail clearly if agent not running
   979	
   980	### 10.2 Commands (normative)
   981	
   982	#### Status
   983	
   984	* `wwk status [--json]`
   985	  Outputs:
   986	* is_working
   987	* current_app
   988	* current_title (nullable)
   989	* accessibility_status
   990	* agent_version
   991	
   992	#### Summaries
   993	
   994	* `wwk summary --from <ISO> --to <ISO> [--group-by app|title|tag|day] [--json]`
   995	* `wwk today [--json]`
   996	* `wwk week [--json]`
   997	
   998	#### Export
   999	
  1000	* `wwk export --from <ISO> --to <ISO> --format csv|json --out <path|-> [--include-titles true|false]`
  1001	
  1002	#### Edits
  1003	
  1004	* `wwk edit delete --from <ISO> --to <ISO> [--note <text>]`
  1005	* `wwk edit add --from <ISO> --to <ISO> --app-name <text> [--bundle-id <id>] [--title <text>] [--tags <t1,t2>] [--note <text>]`
  1006	* `wwk tag apply --from <ISO> --to <ISO> --tag <name>`
  1007	* `wwk tag remove --from <ISO> --to <ISO> --tag <name>`
  1008	* `wwk edit undo --id <uee_id>`
  1009	
  1010	#### Tag management
  1011	
  1012	* `wwk tag list [--json]`
  1013	* `wwk tag create --name <text>`
  1014	* `wwk tag retire --name <text>`
  1015	* `wwk tag rename --from <old> --to <new>` (implementation can be create+retire)
  1016	
  1017	#### Diagnostics
  1018	
  1019	* `wwk doctor` (checks permissions, agent running, db integrity)
  1020	* `wwk db verify` (runs `PRAGMA integrity_check`)
  1021	* `wwk db info` (schema version, counts, date ranges)

  1124	
  1125	## 12. App Store compliance considerations
  1126	
  1127	### 12.1 Background agent / login item
  1128	
  1129	* Use `SMAppService` (macOS 13+) to register the agent as a background task/login item. ([Apple Developer][1])
  1130	* Respect user control: users can disable background items in System Settings. The app must handle “agent disabled” gracefully and surface the disabled state.
  1131	
  1132	### 12.2 Sandboxing and entitlements
  1133	
  1134	Must-have:
  1135	
  1136	* App Sandbox enabled for all executables (app, agent, CLI).
  1137	* App Group entitlement for shared SQLite access.
  1138	
  1139	Must NOT include:
  1140	
  1141	* Network client/server entitlements.
  1142	* Screen Recording entitlements (avoid ScreenCaptureKit, avoid CGWindowListCreateImage).
  1143	* Apple Events automation entitlements (do not control other apps).
  1144	
  1145	### 12.3 Accessibility permission
  1146	
  1147	* Accessibility access is user-granted via System Settings.
  1148	* The app must not attempt to bypass permission.
  1149	* If permission not granted, must still function with app-only attribution.
  1150	
  1151	### 12.4 Privacy manifest / required reason APIs
  1152	
  1153	* Include `PrivacyInfo.xcprivacy` for each target.
  1154	* Apple requires describing use of certain “required reason APIs” for App Store submissions (effective May 1, 2024 for acceptance in App Store Connect). ([Apple Developer][11])
  1155	
  1156	Implementation requirement:
  1157	
  1158	* Inventory APIs used (file timestamps, system boot time, etc.) and declare reasons accordingly.
  1159	
  1160	### 12.5 No telemetry, no analytics
  1161	
  1162	* Do not include third-party analytics SDKs.
  1163	* Do not phone home.
  1164	* Do not collect device identifiers beyond the locally-generated machine_id stored in identity.
  1165	
  1166	### 12.5 CLI exclusion from Mac App Store build
  1167	
  1168	* The Mac App Store build **does not include** the `wwk` CLI.
  1169	* No command-line executables are installed, exposed, or added to PATH by the App Store build.
  1170	* The CLI is distributed separately via Homebrew and direct download.
  1171	
  1172	---
  1173	
  1174	## 13. Privacy and threat model
  1175	
  1176	### 13.1 Data collected (explicit)
  1177	
  1178	Collected:
  1179	
  1180	* Timestamps of working intervals (unlock-derived)
  1181	* Foreground app bundle id and display name
  1182	* Foreground window title (when Accessibility is granted)
  1183	* User edits: added/deleted ranges, tags
  1184	
  1185	Not collected:
  1186	
  1187	* Keystrokes
  1188	* Mouse movement
  1189	* Screenshots
  1190	* Screen contents
  1191	* Network activity
  1192	
  1193	### 13.2 Storage and access boundaries
  1194	
  1195	* Data stored only locally in sandboxed App Group container.
  1196	* Other apps cannot read it unless they share the same App Group entitlement (which they should not).
  1197	* Any process running as the same user with sufficient filesystem access could read data if it breaks out of sandbox via user action (exports) or local compromise.
  1198	
  1199	### 13.3 Threats and mitigations
  1200	
  1201	Threat: Window titles contain sensitive info (documents, client names, URLs in some apps)
  1202	
  1203	* Mitigation: make title capture permission explicit and clearly described.
  1204	* Mitigation: support deletion of time ranges as first-class.
  1205	* Mitigation: export UI includes “exclude window titles” toggle.
  1206	
  1207	Threat: Agent downtime creates ambiguous time
  1208	
  1209	* Mitigation: never invent time during gaps; label as unobserved.
  1210	
  1211	Threat: Tampering with DB
  1212	
  1213	* Mitigation: append-only raw tables enforced by triggers.
  1214	* Mitigation: edits are also append-only; destructive operations are expressed as edit events.
  1215	
  1216	Threat: Forensics
  1217	
  1218	* Mitigation: if user deletes ranges, ensure export and UI views respect deletions.
  1219	* Note: physical disk recovery is out of scope; FileVault is recommended for at-rest protection.
  1220	
  1221	### 13.4 Privacy posture statement
  1222	
  1223	* The product is an on-device personal log.
  1224	* No “productivity scoring.”
  1225	* No remote sync.
  1226

  1253	---
  1254	
  1255	### 14.4 Testing
  1256	## Testing policy (normative)
  1257	
  1258	Testing is a first-class requirement of this specification.
  1259	
  1260	### General rules
  1261	
  1262	* All public functions, methods, and exported APIs **must** have direct unit test coverage.
  1263	* All CLI subcommands **must** have at least one test covering:
  1264	  * successful execution
  1265	  * invalid input or error handling
  1266	* Tests are written **as development proceeds**, not deferred.
  1267	* A feature or module is considered incomplete if corresponding tests are missing.
  1268	
  1269	### Scope-specific requirements
  1270	
  1271	* Storage and schema code:
  1272	  * Every mutation path must be covered by tests.
  1273	  * Immutability guarantees must be asserted by failing tests.
  1274	* Timeline builder:
  1275	  * All edge cases described in the spec must be covered by fixture-driven tests.
  1276	  * Determinism must be verified by repeated runs against the same fixtures.
  1277	* CLI:
  1278	  * Each top-level command and subcommand requires explicit tests.
  1279	  * CLI output must be testable in both human-readable and `--json` modes where applicable.
  1280	
  1281	### Enforcement
  1282	
  1283	* Code that introduces new public behavior without tests is **non-compliant with this specification**.
  1284	* Test coverage is expected to grow monotonically with functionality.
  1285	
  1286	## Implementation acceptance criteria (must-pass checks)
  1287	
  1288	1. If user unlocks screen at T0 and locks at T1, working time includes `[T0, T1)` exactly.
  1289	2. If user sleeps system at T2, working time ends at T2 even if previously unlocked.
  1290	3. If user wakes at T3 and remains locked, no working time is counted until unlock.
  1291	4. Foreground attribution:
  1292	
  1293	   * Switching apps changes attribution within 1 second.
  1294	   * Title changes (tab changes, document changes) are captured when AX supports it; fallback polling captures within 1 second.
  1295	5. No network entitlements; no outbound network calls in codebase.
  1296	6. Raw tables reject UPDATE/DELETE due to triggers.
  1297	7. Edits do not mutate raw data and are reflected in UI, CLI, exports.
  1298	8. CSV/JSON exports match effective timeline exactly.
  1299

// Schema.swift - SQLite schema DDL exactly as specified in SPEC.md Section 6.4

import Foundation

/// Schema version constants and DDL for the well-whaddya-know database.
/// This schema is normative and must not be modified without a spec revision.
public enum Schema {
    /// Current schema version (stored in PRAGMA user_version)
    public static let currentVersion: Int32 = 1
    
    // MARK: - Core Identity and Metadata Tables
    
    static let createIdentityTable = """
        CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS identity (
          identity_id            INTEGER PRIMARY KEY CHECK (identity_id = 1),
          machine_id             TEXT NOT NULL,
          username               TEXT NOT NULL,
          uid                    INTEGER NOT NULL,
          created_ts_us          INTEGER NOT NULL,
          app_group_id           TEXT NOT NULL,
          notes                  TEXT
        );
        """
    
    static let createKvMetadataTable = """
        CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS kv_metadata (
          key                    TEXT PRIMARY KEY,
          value                  TEXT NOT NULL
        );
        """
    
    // MARK: - Dimension Tables
    
    static let createApplicationsTable = """
        CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS applications (
          app_id                 INTEGER PRIMARY KEY,
          bundle_id              TEXT NOT NULL UNIQUE,
          display_name           TEXT NOT NULL,
          first_seen_ts_us       INTEGER NOT NULL
        );
        """
    
    static let createWindowTitlesTable = """
        CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS window_titles (
          title_id               INTEGER PRIMARY KEY,
          title                  TEXT NOT NULL UNIQUE,
          first_seen_ts_us       INTEGER NOT NULL
        );
        """
    
    static let createTagsTable = """
        CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS tags (
          tag_id                 INTEGER PRIMARY KEY,
          name                   TEXT NOT NULL UNIQUE,
          created_ts_us          INTEGER NOT NULL,
          retired_ts_us          INTEGER,
          sort_order             INTEGER NOT NULL DEFAULT 0
        );
        """
    
    // MARK: - Run Tracking Table
    
    static let createAgentRunsTable = """
        CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS agent_runs (
          run_id                 TEXT PRIMARY KEY,
          started_ts_us          INTEGER NOT NULL,
          started_monotonic_ns   INTEGER NOT NULL,
          agent_version          TEXT NOT NULL,
          os_version             TEXT NOT NULL,
          hardware_model         TEXT,
          boot_session_id        TEXT
        );
        """
    
    // MARK: - System State Events Table (Immutable)
    
    static let createSystemStateEventsTable = """
        CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS system_state_events (
          sse_id                 INTEGER PRIMARY KEY,
          run_id                 TEXT NOT NULL REFERENCES agent_runs(run_id),

          event_ts_us            INTEGER NOT NULL,
          event_monotonic_ns     INTEGER NOT NULL,

          is_system_awake        INTEGER NOT NULL CHECK (is_system_awake IN (0,1)),
          is_session_on_console  INTEGER NOT NULL CHECK (is_session_on_console IN (0,1)),
          is_screen_locked       INTEGER NOT NULL CHECK (is_screen_locked IN (0,1)),
          is_working             INTEGER NOT NULL CHECK (is_working IN (0,1)),

          event_kind             TEXT NOT NULL CHECK (
                                   event_kind IN (
                                     'agent_start',
                                     'agent_stop',
                                     'state_change',
                                     'sleep',
                                     'wake',
                                     'poweroff',
                                     'gap_detected',
                                     'clock_change',
                                     'tz_change',
                                     'accessibility_denied',
                                     'accessibility_granted'
                                   )
                                 ),

          source                 TEXT NOT NULL CHECK (
                                   source IN (
                                     'startup_probe',
                                     'workspace_notification',
                                     'timer_poll',
                                     'iokit_power',
                                     'shutdown_hook',
                                     'manual'
                                   )
                                 ),

          tz_identifier          TEXT NOT NULL,
          tz_offset_seconds      INTEGER NOT NULL,

          payload_json           TEXT
        );
        """
"}

# Conversation Summary

## 1. Previous Conversation

The user requested implementation of the SQLite storage layer for a macOS time-tracking application called "well-whaddya-know". The project has a frozen specification in `SPEC.md` that uses Swift and follows an event-sourcing architecture with immutable SQLite tables. The user provided explicit implementation scope limited to:
- SQLite schema DDL (exact implementation from SPEC.md Section 6.4)
- SQLite connection configuration with required PRAGMAs (Section 6.1)
- Schema versioning and migrations (Section 6.3)
- Comprehensive unit tests for all functionality

The user explicitly stated what is OUT OF SCOPE: UI components, background agent, XPC communication, Accessibility APIs, CLI, packaging, timeline builder logic, reporting queries, and sensor wrappers.

## 2. Current Work

I was implementing the storage layer and unit tests for the well-whaddya-know project. The work progressed through these stages:

1. Created a feature branch `feature/storage-layer`
2. Created Swift Package structure with `Package.swift`
3. Implemented the complete SQLite schema in `Sources/Shared/Storage/Schema.swift` with all tables, indexes, and immutability triggers exactly as specified
4. Implemented database connection management in `Sources/Shared/Storage/DatabaseConnection.swift` with required PRAGMA configurations
5. Implemented schema versioning and migrations in `Sources/Shared/Storage/SchemaManager.swift`
6. Created comprehensive unit tests but encountered an issue: XCTest is not available with just Command Line Tools (Xcode is not installed on the system)
7. Converted tests from XCTest to Swift Testing framework (available in Swift 6.2 without Xcode)
8. Successfully converted `StorageTests.swift` and `ImmutabilityTests.swift` to use Swift Testing
9. Was in the process of converting `ForeignKeyTests.swift` when the summary was requested

The most recent action was completing the conversion of `ImmutabilityTests.swift` from XCTest to Swift Testing framework, replacing `XCTAssert*` calls with `#expect` and class-based tests with struct-based `@Suite` and `@Test` attributes.

## 3. Key Technical Concepts

- **Swift Package Manager (SPM)**: Project structure using Package.swift
- **Swift Testing Framework**: Modern testing framework (not XCTest) available in Swift 6.2+
- **SQLite3**: Direct C API usage for database operations
- **Event Sourcing Architecture**: Immutable append-only event tables
- **PRAGMA Configuration**: SQLite settings per SPEC.md Section 6.1:
  - `foreign_keys = ON`
  - `journal_mode = WAL`
  - `synchronous = NORMAL`
  - `busy_timeout = 5000`
  - `temp_store = MEMORY`
- **Schema Versioning**: Using `PRAGMA user_version` for forward-only migrations
- **Immutability Triggers**: BEFORE UPDATE/DELETE triggers that RAISE(ABORT) on event tables
- **In-memory databases**: Using `:memory:` for unit tests
- **macOS 13+ (Ventura)**: Minimum platform requirement

## 4. Relevant Files and Code

### Package.swift
- Created Swift Package with Storage library target and StorageTests test target
- Platform: macOS 13+
- Swift tools version: 5.9

### Sources/Shared/Storage/Schema.swift
- Contains exact DDL from SPEC.md Section 6.4
- All table definitions: `identity`, `kv_metadata`, `applications`, `window_titles`, `tags`, `agent_runs`, `system_state_events`, `raw_activity_events`, `user_edit_events`, `schema_migrations`
- All indexes for event tables
- Immutability triggers for three event tables:
  - `trg_sse_no_update` and `trg_sse_no_delete` for `system_state_events`
  - `trg_rae_no_update` and `trg_rae_no_delete` for `raw_activity_events`
  - `trg_uee_no_update` and `trg_uee_no_delete` for `user_edit_events`
- Helper properties: `allTableStatements`, `allIndexStatements`, `allTriggerStatements`, `allStatements`
- Current schema version: 1

### Sources/Shared/Storage/DatabaseConnection.swift
- Manages SQLite database connections
- `open()` method applies all required PRAGMAs
- `execute()` method for SQL execution
- `getSchemaVersion()` and `setSchemaVersion()` for PRAGMA user_version
- `getPragmaValue()` and `getPragmaIntValue()` for querying PRAGMA settings
- `verifyPragmas()` returns dictionary of all PRAGMA settings
- `rawPointer` property for advanced operations
- Error handling via `DatabaseError` enum

### Sources/Shared/Storage/SchemaManager.swift
- Manages schema initialization and migrations
- `initializeSchema()` handles both fresh databases and migrations
- `Migration` struct for version, description, and SQL statements
- Forward-only migration system
- Records migrations in `schema_migrations` table
- Version 1 migration includes all initial schema statements

### Sources/Shared/Storage/Storage.swift
- Public API module file
- Exports current schema version

### Tests/Unit/StorageTests.swift
- Converted to Swift Testing framework
- Uses `@Suite("Storage Tests")` and `@Test` attributes
- Tests schema initialization from scratch
- Tests all tables are created
- Tests schema initialization is idempotent
- Tests all PRAGMA configurations (foreign_keys, journal_mode, synchronous, busy_timeout, temp_store)
- Helper method `tableExists()` for verification

### Tests/Unit/ImmutabilityTests.swift
- Converted to Swift Testing framework
- Uses `@Suite("Immutability Trigger Tests")`
- `setupConnection()` helper creates connection with schema and prerequisite data
- Tests UPDATE rejection on all three event tables
- Tests DELETE rejection on all three event tables
- Tests INSERT still works on all three event tables
- Uses `#expect(throws: DatabaseError.self)` for error assertions

### Tests/Unit/ForeignKeyTests.swift
- Still using XCTest (needs conversion)
- Tests foreign key constraint enforcement
- Tests invalid run_id, app_id, tag_id references
- Tests nullable foreign keys work correctly

## 5. Problem Solving

**Problem**: XCTest not available without Xcode installation
- System has Swift 6.2.3 with Command Line Tools only
- Attempted `swift test` and `xcrun swift test` both failed with "no such module 'XCTest'"
- Attempted `xcodebuild test` failed because Xcode is not installed

**Solution**: Convert all tests to Swift Testing framework
- Swift Testing is available in Swift 6.2+ without Xcode
- Converted from class-based `XCTestCase` to struct-based `@Suite`
- Converted from `func test*()` to `@Test("description") func name()`
- Converted from `XCTAssertEqual` to `#expect(a == b)`
- Converted from `XCTAssertThrowsError` to `#expect(throws: ErrorType.self)`
- Converted from `XCTAssertNoThrow` to direct `try` calls
- Removed `setUp()`/`tearDown()` in favor of per-test setup with `defer { connection.close() }`

**Status**: Two test files converted (StorageTests.swift, ImmutabilityTests.swift), one remaining (ForeignKeyTests.swift)

## 6. Pending Tasks and Next Steps

3. **Commit the storage layer implementation** to the feature branch with appropriate commit messages

4. **Push the feature branch** to remote (per user's instruction: "You do not need approval to continue if tests are passing")

5. **Verify success criteria from user's request**:
